content: christmas bunting sweater this sweater is designed to hang on a cord to make christmas bunting but can also be used to make christmas tree ornaments or to dress toys the lower body is knitted in the round from the bottom up on 60 sts on reaching the level of the sleeves we switch from working in the round to working back and forth on half 30 the sts extra sts are cast on for the sleeves and we work up the front towards the neckline then over the shoulders and down the back the extra sleeve sts are bound off against their cast on sts saving having to sew up the seams lastly the 30 back sts are joined to the 30 lower body sts with kitchener stitch if kitchener stitch isn t your thing it can be finished with a 3 needle bind off size the sweaters are approximately 26cm wide cuff to cuff and 16cm high requirements 4 5 mm us 7 needles for knitting in the round or size required for desired gauge/size 1 stitch marker 1 tapestry yarn needle yarn approximately 30g of dk yarn per sweater in as many colours as you like try to use a lightweight yarn - to reduce the overall weight on the bunting cord i knitted my sweaters from just red and white but don t let my colour choices limit you be creative and have fun other yarn thicknesses and needle sizes can be used to make different larger or smaller sized sweaters gauge 22 sts and 28 row = 10 cm x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches measured over stocking stitch pattern with 4 5mm needles but gauge isn t really important for this project mrs rose designs… 1 this pattern is for your personal use only © mrsrosedesigns1@gmail com christmas bunting sweater abbreviations and techniques k knit p purl st/s stitch / stitches lh left hand rh right hand rem remain m1p make 1 purl k2tog knit 2 sts together beg beginning decrease decrease bor beginning of the round techniques m1p with your lh needle pick up the bar between the st on the rh and lh needle from front to back and purl through its back leg kitchener stitch the are free video tutorials available on the internet to show how to work kitchener stitch if you havent tried it before have a go its not difficult its actually quite good fun and gives a very professional finish instructions main body 3 rounds of k1-p1 rib then 26 rounds of stocking stitch cast on 60 sts using 4 5 mm us 7 needles join for knitting in the round and place a bor marker slip the marker from the lh to the rh needle each time you come to it band round 1 *k1-p1 repeat from * to the end of the round band rounds 2 and 3 as for band round 1 rounds 1-26 work 26 rounds of stocking stitch incorporating some sort
